key_points: Donald Trump returned to the political stage with a speech at the North Carolina Republican Party state convention.
Trump attacked Democrats, Republican critics, and lamented social media bans and criminal investigations against him.
He repeated baseless claims of voter fraud in the 2020 election and hinted at a possible 2024 presidential run.
Trump endorsed U.S. Rep. Ted Budd for a North Carolina U.S. Senate seat, over other Republicans.
Criticized President Joe Biden, "radical Democrats", and attacked media and Anthony Fauci over COVID-19 handling.
Trump's recent appearances and statements have shown his continued influence within the Republican Party.
Prosecutors in New York and Georgia have intensified investigations related to Trump.
Trump allies ousted Liz Cheney from her House GOP leadership position due to her criticism of Trump.
Ammar Moussa, a Democratic Party spokesperson, criticized Republicans' continued allegiance to Trump.
Trump has been banned from major social media platforms but hinted at resuming mass political rallies soon.
spokespersons: Doug Heye (Republican strategist, North Carolina native)
